alert.note: Alert for Finney; Grant; Haskell; Kearny (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 25 at 12:27AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN KEARNY... SOUTHWESTERN FINNEY...NORTHEASTERN GRANT AND NORTHWESTERN HASKELL COUNTIES THROUGH 115 AM CDT... At 1227 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Ulysses, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Kearny, southwestern Finney, northeastern Grant and northwestern Haskell Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
